item.title: Fed's Goolsbee Likens Rate Pause to 'Reconnaissance' on Policy
item.description: Fed’s Goolsbee Likens Rate Pause to ‘Reconnaissance’ on Policy The Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said the central bank’s decision to pause interest rate hikes is a “reconnaissance mission” to assess the impact of its previous rate increases.

item.title: For the Fed, Doing Nothing Is the Greater Risk
item.description: The Federal Reserve is facing a difficult decision: raise interest rates to combat inflation, or risk a recession. If the Fed does nothing, inflation could spiral out of control, leading to a loss of faith in the dollar and a severe economic downturn.

item.title: US Inflation: Great Post-Covid Scare Enters Final Phase
item.description: Inflation Peaking in Coming Months, but Economy Still Facing Challenges Inflation is expected to peak in the coming months, but the economy is still facing a number of challenges. The Federal Reserve is trying to engineer a “soft landing” for the economy, but it is not clear whether they will be successful.

item.title: Fed Backs Away From Wages Focus, Bolstering Case for Rate Pause
item.description: Fed Backs Away From Wages Focus, Bolstering Case for Rate Pause The Federal Reserve is backing away from its focus on wage growth as a guide for monetary policy, a shift that could bolster the case for a pause in interest rate hikes later this year.

item.title: US Economy Remains 'Very, Very Hot,' Larry Summers Says
item.description: US Economy: Is a Recession Coming? Former US Treasury Secretary Larry Summers has warned that the US economy is “very, very hot” and that there is a risk of a recession. Summers said that the Federal Reserve needs to take aggressive action to cool the economy, including raising interest rates by more than 0.
